meanings.definition: A person who causes trouble or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The troubler in the class always disrupted the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The troubler was known for stirring up arguments among friends.
meanings.sent3: The troubler accidentally spilled paint all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her mischievous cat was a real troubler, knocking things off shelves.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the troubler who likes to play pranks on everyone.

meanings.definition: Something that causes trouble or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The broken lock was a real troubler for the homeowners.
meanings.sent2: The leaky roof proved to be a constant troubler during the rainy season.
meanings.sent3: The missing ingredient turned out to be the troubler in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The old car's engine became a troubler, causing frequent breakdowns.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds on the horizon signaled the troubler of an approaching storm.
